bill.title: Requesting The Department Of Health To Apply To The Drug Enforcement Administration's Office Of Diversion Control For An Exception Under Title 21 Code Of Federal Regulations Section 1307.03, And Request Formal Written Acknowledgment That The Listing Of Marihuana, Marihuana Extract, And Tetrahydrocannabinols As Controlled Substances In Federal Schedule I Does Not Apply To The Protected Activities In Hawaii Revised Statutes.
bill.description: Requesting The Department Of Health To Apply To The Drug Enforcement Administration's Office Of Diversion Control For An Exception Under Title 21 Code Of Federal Regulations Section 1307.03, And Request Formal Written Acknowledgment That The Listing Of Marihuana, Marihuana Extract, And Tetrahydrocannabinols As Controlled Substances In Federal Schedule I Does Not Apply To The Protected Activities In Hawaii Revised Statutes.

history.action: Offered
Referred to HHH, JHA, referral sheet 25
Resolution scheduled to be heard by HHH on Tuesday, 03-23-21 9:00AM in conference room 329 Via Videoconference.

The committees on HHH recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Representative(s) Yamane, Tam, Gates, Har, Kapela, Nishimoto, Ward; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) LoPresti.
Reported from HHH (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1289) as amended in HD 1, recommending referral to JHA.
Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on JHA as amended in HD 1 with Representative(s) Okimoto voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
Resolution scheduled to be heard by JHA on Monday, 03-29-21 2:00PM in conference room 325 Via Videoconference.

The committees on JHA recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 10 Ayes: Representative(s) Nakashima, Matayoshi, Ichiyama, D. Kobayashi, Lowen, McKelvey, Takumi, Todd, Tokioka; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Ward; 0 Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) LoPresti, Nakamura.
Reported from JHA (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1618), recommending adoption.
Adopted with Representative(s) Okimoto, Ward voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Gates, Ohno excused (2).
Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 375).
Referred to HTH, JDC.
The committee(s) on HTH has scheduled a public hearing on 04-09-21 1:10PM; Via Videoconference.

The committee(s) on HTH recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in HTH were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Keohokalole, Baker, San Buenaventura, Fevella; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Moriwaki ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from HTH (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1717), as amended (SD 1), with recommendation of referral to JDC.
Report adopted, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDC.
The committee(s) on JDC will hold a public decision making on 04-16-21 10:00AM; Via Videoconference.

The committee(s) on JDC recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in JDC were as follows: 6 Aye(s): Senator(s) Rhoads, Keohokalole, Acasio, Kim, Lee, Fevella; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Gabbard.
Reported from JDC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1789) with recommendation of adoption.
Report and Resolution Adopted. Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Inouye, Moriwaki. Noes, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 833) in amended form (SD 1).
House agrees to Senate amendment(s).
Deferred one day 04-23-21.
Received notice of House agreement (Hse. Com. No. 622)
Adopted with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) DeCoite, Har, Nakamura, Tokioka excused (4).
Received notice of Adoption in House (Hse. Com. No. 631).
Resolution adopted in final form.

votes.desc: House Health, Human Services, & Homelessness: Passed, With Amendments
House Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs: Passed, Unamended

calendar.description: House Health, Human Services, & Homelessness Hearing
